level_2_v1.question: Which of the following best describes a case status marked as 'New' in the JCF Connect Investigation Module?
options: The case has been recently created and not yet submitted.
The case has been rejected due to lack of evidence.
The case is currently being investigated.
The case requires further information before proceeding.

level_2_v1.question: What does the 'Requires Completion' status indicate in the JCF Connect Investigation Module?
options: The case is awaiting allocation to an investigator.
The case is under review for quality assurance.
The case has been initiated but needs to be completed.
The case has been rejected and requires closure.

level_2_v1.question: What is the meaning of 'Requires Assessment/Review' status in the JCF Connect Investigation Module?
options: The case needs to be assigned to a team.
The case requires a comprehensive review or assessment.
The case has been completed and closed.
The case needs more information for further investigation.

level_2_v1.question: In the JCF Connect Investigation Module, what does 'Requires QA' mean?
options: The case has been newly filed.
The case requires Quality Assurance checks.
The case needs to be allocated to a team.
The case requires additional data for completion.

level_2_v1.question: In the context of the JCF Connect Investigation Module, what does 'Requires Allocation' imply?
options: The case requires more information.
The case needs to be assigned to an investigator or a team.
The case has been completed.
The case has been rejected.

level_2_v1.question: If a case status is 'Under Investigation' in the JCF Connect Investigation Module, what does it suggest?
options: The case needs more data for completion.
The case is currently being worked on or investigated.
The case requires quality assurance.
The case has been completed and filed.

level_2_v1.question: What does the 'Rejected' status mean in the JCF Connect Investigation Module?
options: The case has been refused or dismissed.
The case is under comprehensive review.
The case is under investigation.
The case needs to be assigned to a team.

level_2_v1.question: What does a 'Requires Further Information' status signify in the JCF Connect Investigation Module?
options: The case has been completed.
The case needs additional data or details to proceed.
The case is under quality assurance review.
The case has been assigned to an investigator.

level_2_v1.question: What does the 'Filed' status indicate in the JCF Connect Investigation Module?
options: The case is being investigated.
The case needs to be allocated to a team.
The case has been rejected.
The case has been completed and officially documented.

level_2_v1.question: What is the role of a supervisor in the process of Investigative Review in JCF Connect?
options: Only to update the enquiry log (worksheet)
Only to generate customer receipt (CR10)
To ensure all necessary steps in the investigative process are completed accurately
None of the above

level_2_v1.question: Which one of these items is not directly verified by the supervisor during the Investigative Review process in JCF Connect?
options: The existence of relevant cards
The recording and attaching of statements
The recording of officers remaining leave
The generation of customer receipt (CR10)

level_2_v1.question: What might the supervisor check for any data that may have been overlooked by?
options: The appreciating officer
The OIC
Both the appreciating officer and the OIC
Neither the appreciating officer nor the OIC

level_2_v1.question: What is the significance of associations in the Investigative Review process in JCF Connect?
options: They are used for meal planning for officers
They are irrelevant to the Investigative Review process
They ensure the correct connections are made in the investigative process
They are a code for undercover operations

level_2_v1.question: What must be generated as part of the Investigative Review process in JCF Connect?
options: An officer's report card
A customer receipt (CR10)
A press release
A search warrant

level_2_v1.question: What is the purpose of a Decision Log Card in an investigation?
options: To track the number of suspects
To record the justification of certain lines of enquiry
To provide suspects with their rights
To list all evidence found at the crime scene

level_2_v1.question: When can a user add entries to a decision log or policy file?
options: Only before the investigation is created
Only after the investigation is created and when it is in progress
At any point during an investigation
After the investigation has concluded

level_2_v1.question: In which cases is a Decision Log Card generally used?
options: Minor crimes
Traffic violations
Serious or complicated crimes
Civil cases

level_2_v1.question: What does RADAR in the context of investigations stand for?
options: Radar Analysis of Decision and Reasoning
Real-time Analysis of Data
Risk Assessment Data Analysis Review
Radar Analysis and Data Review

level_2_v1.question: What is the purpose of the RADAR facility within the application?
options: To monitor weather conditions relevant to the investigation
To record the daily activities of officers
To allow external datasets to be searched in addition to the POLE data store
To track the location of investigating officers
